page.title: 06Coddenham Village Store
page.content: Like most rural village areas in the 80's, shops are few and far between whereas up to a few years ago there were 3 grocers, 3 butchers, bakers and other stores in Coddenham village alone. Now the traditional family grocer's shop in Coddenham serves the area in an excellent old-fashioned way, with a varied stock of groceries, confectionary, frozen foods, wines, spirits and fresh vegetables. The owners and staff give first class personal service to customers, high- lighted in Feb. 1985 by the store being nominated for a bouquet award from Anglia TV's "Checkpoint" consumer watchdog programme, by a grateful customer residing in a nearby village. She had enjoyed a free fortnightly delivery service for 65 years without ever setting foot in the shop until the visit to present the award.
